subject: Economics
title: The Nutrition Trap: When Hunger Prevents Escape from Hunger
description: One-minute skill: The Nutrition Trap: When Hunger Prevents Escape from Hunger.

hook.text: A malnourished child's brain develops 30% fewer neural connections. By age 5, the damage is permanent.

buildup.text: 828 million people go hungry. Malnutrition in the first 1,000 days of life reduces adult earnings by 20%.

discovery.text: The nutrition trap: malnourished children learn less, earn less, and can't afford to feed their own children properly.

twist.text: Banerjee and Duflo found that when the very poor get more money, they often buy tastier food rather than more calories.

climax.text: Breaking the nutrition trap requires targeting the first 1,000 days.

punchline.text: The cheapest way to fight poverty is to feed a pregnant woman properly.

quiz.question: Why are the first 1,000 days of life critical for development?
options: Children learn to walk during this period
Malnutrition during this window permanently reduces brain development and adult earning potential by up to 20%
